paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on BRCA2 variants, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Specifically, a single SNP in intron 24 was associated with a two-fold increased risk for breast cancer.

functional_data.summary: The SNP in intron 24 suggests a subtle variant can serve as a marker for increased risk for cancer.

variants.additional_notes: The SNP is associated with a two-fold increased risk for breast cancer.
key_quotes: genetic variation in BRCA2 was shown to result in an increased risk for sporadic breast cancer in the Multiethnic Cohort (MEC).
Specifically, a single SNP in intron 24 was associated with a two-fold increased risk for breast cancer.

extraction_metadata.notes: Extracted data was primarily from the main text with no tables containing BRCA2 variants.
